title: Ticket #7605: condor_gpu_discovery crashes on PowerPC
description:
I just built 8.8.8-1 for PowerPC (rhel7). It works okay, but dumps core with gpu-detection.

After some debugging, if found an error in 'condor_gpu_discovery.cpp' (stack i.s.o. heap allocation). Please find the diff below. On x86_64 apparently this is not triggered (although I did see the occasional coredump of this exec) 

--- condor_gpu_discovery.cpp.old        2020-04-17 11:30:42.037789221 +0200
+++ condor_gpu_discovery.cpp.new        2020-04-17 11:31:32.593811467 +0200
@@ -541,9 +541,11 @@
                print_error(MODE_DIAGNOSTIC_MSG, "# cuDeviceTotalMem(%d) returns %d, value = %llu\n", devID, er, (unsigned long long)mem);
        }

-               char name[256];
-               memset(name, 0, sizeof(name));
-               cuDeviceGetName(name, sizeof(name), dev);
+               // Alloc on heap, not stack, as it is passed out of this function
+               char *name;
+               name = (char*)malloc (256);
+               cuDeviceGetName(name, 256, dev);
+
                p->name = name;
                if (cuDeviceGetUuid) cuDeviceGetUuid(p->uuid, dev);
                if (cuDeviceGetPCIBusId) cuDeviceGetPCIBusId(p->pciId, sizeof(p->pciId), dev);
remarks:
2020-Apr-17 09:26:58 by tim:
CODE REVIEW: LGTM

2020-Apr-17 10:31:23 by tim:
It turns out that it copies into a std::string. So, that's not the problem. My bad.

2020-Apr-17 11:12:58 by tim:
Bert will try out our patch on Monday: "At first sight, it looks ok to me. I'll try it Monday morning and report back.

Incidentally, the very same error is in condor_gpu_utilization.cpp (with the same fix).

To be continued ..."

2020-Apr-18 11:03:23 by tim:
Bert reports that the updates work fine.

2020-Apr-18 11:04:47 by tim:
CODE REVIEW: Looks much better.
